item.title: While Shrem, Ulbricht Enjoy Cults of Personality, Shavers Abandoned by Bitcoin Community
item.description:
While Shrem, Ulbricht Enjoy Cults of Personality, Shavers Abandoned by Bitcoin Community

Trendon Shavers earned a lenient sentence through good faith efforts to right the wrongs he did while improperly managing the Bitcoin Savings & Trust, Bitcoin's first federal securities case, according to his sentencing judge. That's news the Bitcoin Community, which has long viewed Shavers as a no more than a fraudster, likely won't heed.

item.title: The Case for Ethereum Classic - NEWSBTC
item.description:
The Case for Ethereum Classic - NEWSBTC

The Ethereum hard fork to bail out the DAO Project was successful, but not without its consequences. Many assumed the old chain would simply die, however it has not only survived, but continues to grow under the name Ethereum Classic (ETC). This has forced cryptocurrency investors to make a choice on the immutability issue...

item.title: Gibraltar Stock Exchange welcomes BitcoinETI
item.description:
Gibraltar Stock Exchange welcomes BitcoinETI

The Gibraltar Stock Exchange welcomes BitcoinETI (ticker: BTCETI), an asset-backed Exchange Traded Instrument that is invested exclusively in bitcoin, making it the first European regulated product for the leading digital currency. The Bitcoin Exchange Traded Instrument (ETI) was approved for admission to listing on GSX on 22-Jul-2015 and will be co-listed on Deutsche BÃ¶rse this week under the symbol "BTCETI".

item.title: Agentic Blockchain Consortium Expands To London - Bitcoin News
item.description:
Agentic Blockchain Consortium Expands To London - Bitcoin News

New York-based blockchain consortium Also read: David Seaman: Ethereum Classic 'Little More Than Troll Vaporware' Agentic Group has announced its latest expansion into the UK. The organization, composed of over 35 distributed ledger and cryptocurrency projects, aims to demystify these protocols by providing leadership and R&D opportunities.

item.title: Is the decentralized part of blockchain a "must have" in order to consider a particular implementation to be based on BTC?
item.description:
Is the decentralized part of blockchain a "must have" in order to consider a particular implementation to be based on BTC?

Answer (1 of 3): No, the only consideration needed for a blockchain implementation to be based on BTC is to use the original source code - ie making a clone of the original Bitcoin. Whether or not it is decentralised is not an issue. You can install your own instance of Bitcoin and distribute it...

item.title: Do all contracts on the blockchain have to be "smart" or can you just record static contract agreements that aren't going to change?
item.description:
Do all contracts on the blockchain have to be "smart" or can you just record static contract agreements that aren't going to change?

Answer: Smart contracts are static contract agreements that aren't going to change. If they could change at will, they wouldn't be much of a contract, wouldn't they? :) What's "smart" about a smart contract is that it can check whether the conditions have been fulfilled - for example if you're g...

item.title: Is it safe to import my private key into another wallet?
item.description:
Is it safe to import my private key into another wallet?

I sent some bitcoin to my bitcoin core wallet before it synced, not knowing this sync would take days, and was wondering if i was to import my private key into a different wallet if that would work?
